More Notes: The North and Northeast will have great impacts, while the South may even benefit.
Maximum decline for some regions due to agricultural losses.
1°C increase in average temperature causes losses of up to 20% to national agriculture. This is based on the 1960-2006 historical analysis, so a midpoint is chosen.
1°C increase in warming reduces land values by 5% for the most productive farmers in the South. This is based on the 1960-2006 historical analysis, so a midpoint is chosen.
1°C increase in warming reduces land values by 34% for the least productive farmers in the North. This is based on the 1960-2006 historical analysis, so a midpoint is chosen.
